ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions.Function
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArgumentPlaceholder, ConstantFunction, FunctionTree, SimpleFunction, TracePlaceholder

    public abstract class Function
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Contextualizable
    Represents a stateless m-to-n function.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

        public static int s_maxInputArity

    • Constructor Detail

      • Function

        public Function()

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract Object[] evaluate(Object[] inputs,
                Context context)
        Evaluates the outputs of the function, given some inputs
        Parameters:
        inputs - The arguments of the function. The size of the array should be equal to the function's declared input arity.
        context - The context in which the evaluation is done. If the function's arguments contains placeholders, they will be replaced by the corresponding object fetched from this map before evaluating the function
        Returns:
        The outputs of the function. The size of the array returned should be equal to the function's declared output arity.

      • evaluate

        public abstract Object[] evaluate(Object[] inputs)
        Evaluates the outputs of the function, given some inputs
        Parameters:
        inputs - The arguments of the function. The size of the array should be equal to the function's declared input arity.
        Returns:
        The outputs of the function. The size of the array returned should be equal to the function's declared output arity.

      • getInputArity

        public abstract int getInputArity()
        Gets the function's input arity, i.e. the number of arguments it takes.
        Returns:
        The input arity

      • getOutputArity

        public abstract int getOutputArity()
        Gets the function's output arity, i.e. the number of elements it outputs. (We expect that most functions will have an output arity of 1.)
        Returns:
        The output arity

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        Resets the function to its initial state. In the case of a stateless function, nothing requires to be done.

      • clone

        public Function clone(Context context)
        Creates a copy of the function
        Parameters:
        context - The context in which to clone this function
        Returns:
        The copy

        Returns:

      • getInputTypesFor

        public abstract void getInputTypesFor(Set<Class<?>> classes,
                    int index)
        Populates the set of classes accepted by the function for its i-th input
        Parameters:
        classes - The set of to fill with classes
        index - The index of the input to query

      • getOutputTypeFor

        public abstract Class<?> getOutputTypeFor(int index)
        Returns the type of the events produced by the function for its i-th output
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the output to query
        Returns:
        The type of the output
